newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore's Popular Book Co may seek listing.
newsitem.headline: Singapore's Popular Book Co may seek listing.

text.p: Bilingual bookstore chain Popular Book Company may seek a listing on the mainboard of the Stock Exchange of Singapore (SES) this year, two Singapore newspapers said on Saturday.
The Straits Times quoted sources as saying Popular had already submitted its listing application to the SES, and the Business Times said a listing was likely to come this year.
But Popular managing director Chou Cheng Ngok would only say the company is thinking of a listing, the Business Times said.
It said the company had a turnover of Singapore $126.3 million last year.
Popular is investing in a new warehouse and office facility and an automatic storage and retrieval system, the newspapers said.
The chain has operations in Singapore, Malaysia and Hong Kong.
